page.title: 05THE WEST SOMERSET RAILWAY
page.content: British Rail closed the line from Minehead to Taunton in 1971.The West Somerset Railway has been in existance since 1976. It is privately owned.The line runs from{Minehead}to {Bishops Lydeard}near Taunton which is a distance of 23 miles. There is a coach link to Taunton as the track between Bishops Lydeard and Taunton is still owned by British Rail. There are 9 stations altogether.They are{Minehead,Dunster, Blue Anchor, {Washford, Watchet, Williton, } {Stogumber, Crowcombe and Bishops } Lydeard. The line carries about 58,ooo passengers a year,most of whom are tourists.The line runs diesel locomotives but it is particularly famous for its' collection of{steam} engines.Three are in working order at present and three are being restored. during the season about 10 people are
